C69A2CB2A63444AA8A051ABBCAFD6593.description: demonstrate the ability to create new clothing or accessories from recycled materials or garments (e.g., turn drink boxes into a bag; candy wrappers into a necklace; neckties into a skirt; a necktie into a handle for a bag; jeans into a skirt or a bag; tea towels into a dress; fabric samples into a tote, cosmetic bag, laptop case, or music player pouch)

EBA77A9EFC53496EB0BA555C561AF220.description: demonstrate the ability to create clothing or accessories using basic construction techniques (e.g., machine and/or hand sewing, knitting, crocheting, beading)

623762B8B772469B8D69819D7E15BB82.description: demonstrate the ability to repair and/or alter personal clothing or accessories using basic sewing skills (e.g., repair a seam, seam finish a raw edge, alter a hem, apply an appliqu√©, replace a button, create an elastic casing)

40E543C5617C4B1BB34D4D985AE78FE3.description: demonstrate the ability to follow preconstruction procedures (e.g., measuring, interpreting pattern envelopes and patterns, laying out patterns, preparing fabric and other materials, understanding knitting or crocheting instructions) when creating clothing or accessories

3155B80D379C4CD8B23E03521BB1308A.description: Procedures, Skills, and Techniques: demonstrate the ability to use appropriate procedures, skills, and techniques to create and repair clothing or accessories.

C00CC213AA0646D5AD8A200B7074F692.description: use tools and technologies correctly when creating personal clothing or accessories (e.g., tools/technologies associated with cutting, pressing, pinning, sewing, knitting, crocheting)

702518C93CE64F569FFBBC00C485F161.description: demonstrate the safe use of tools and technologies when creating and/or repairing clothing and accessories (e.g., safe practices when using sharp objects such as pins, needles, or scissors, or chemicals such as dye or glue)

21296EFF5917468DBBF24B727D191C83.description: identify various tools and technologies used when creating and/or repairing clothing and accessories (e.g., measuring tape, seam ripper, scissors, iron, pressing ham, sewing machine, serger, loom, knitting needles, crochet hook) Teacher prompt: "In what ways are craft scissors different from sewing scissors?"

096CE83D4B57471880A5263A8EDFC0EC.description: Tools and Technologies: identify a variety of tools and technologies associated with the creation of clothing and accessories, and use tools and technologies safely and correctly when creating and/or repairing clothing and accessories;

0DD688D855344110B037A88EFD978F9C.description: explain how the elements of design can enhance or detract from a person's appearance and comfort (e.g., vertical lines make the wearer appear taller, soft fabrics enhance comfort), and consequently which elements should be considered when selecting clothing and accessories

B9DD97013EBF47F99241D18BBB77A162.description: identify and describe the elements of design (e.g., line, shape, colour, texture) as they apply to clothing and accessories

D0A9F90E0B374E8D883684F226A30346.description: Elements of Design: describe the elements of design related to clothing and accessories, and explain how an awareness of these elements can affect personal clothing choices;

FDEBDF5D410E4DA18302D89AC37A41B0.description: describe ways, including environmentally responsible ways, to care for garments to maintain their appearance and extend their life (e.g., with respect to following clothing care labels; laundering, ironing, removing stains from, and storing garments made from different kinds of fabrics; using environmentally responsible detergents and stain-removal practices)

2CC8BA005DC24159808AF8BF6E04368F.description: explain how knowledge of natural and synthetic fibres and fabrics, including how they are produced, can affect clothing choices (e.g., the selection of breathable lightweight cottons and rayons for summer clothes; wool or polar fleece for winter outerwear; silk or cashmere for softness next to the skin; organic cotton or hemp to limit environmental damage arising from the production of traditionally farmed cotton or petroleum-based polyester; down or synthetic fibre for insulation in outerwear)

7E79CC4FEF404E5C8145CA3D9C0F1FC4.description: identify common natural and synthetic fibres (e.g., cotton, silk, linen, wool, hemp, rayon, polyester, nylon, spandex) and describe their characteristics

0F1C50CEF7CB4FAF81043B6AAB6F04B0.description: Fibres and Fabric Care: demonstrate an understanding of natural and synthetic fibres and fabrics, and of how their characteristics affect clothing choices and care.

9557303025CA4801A21C5BF6F438B43C.description: describe different types of retail promotions (e.g., in-store displays, billboards, magazine advertising, clearance sales, online surveys), and explain the effect of these promotions on their decisions about clothing purchases

79D36F179E6E488DBFB61B9A989C9252.description: explain how various retail formats can affect the ways individuals shop for and purchase clothing and accessories (e.g., with reference to shopping with peers, accessing unique products, comparison shopping, impulse buying)

F55813A0BB064B49BAA14889830A2CC4.description: identify and describe various retail formats for clothing and accessories (e.g., department stores, chain stores, boutiques, specialty shops, second-hand stores, online shopping sites, outlet stores, shopping channels on television)

64F42841C3494D00839C7C4334A04330.description: Retail Approaches: demonstrate an understanding of the effects that retail formats and promotions can have on individualsÔøΩ decisions about clothing purchases;

4C656784D9C849B7B0868FD6ACC898F0.description: assess the quality of selected garments and accessories (e.g., work clothes, outerwear, sports garments, shoes, garments for special occasions)

1D20E711C71D457D9556FE979E0CAC86.description: explain the criteria for evaluating the quality, value, and suitability of clothing and accessories (e.g., straight and secure stitching on seams, which allows garments to hang, wear, and wash well; durable fabrics for garments and accessories that will be worn and/or washed frequently)

D55EB79543CD4650AFAF2187542995D5.description: Evaluating Clothing: demonstrate an understanding of how to evaluate the quality, value, and suitability of clothing and accessories;

E0FF6F85DA2B45D9A7B2000799D102C3.description: describe dress codes for a variety of situations and groups (e.g., with reference to situations at school, special occasions, a school dance, a funeral, various workplaces, a wedding, family functions; with reference to groups such as athletic teams, police officers, members of the military) and the effects such codes can have on personal wardrobe planning

A9820A1D625244A081CF1508B12E754B.description: describe the steps and processes involved in personal wardrobe planning (e.g., using a decision-making model, evaluating current wardrobe, identifying needs and wants, determining personal resources such as money for clothing and skills to alter or repair clothing, planning for special occasions)

540F01204F9B4957ACD65E934A5A8349.description: describe various criteria used in wardrobe planning (e.g., price, style, storage space, availability, what peers are wearing, family rules or traditions, cultural traditions, physical needs), and explain how these criteria affect their personal clothing and accessory selections

ECF5A5EA8B854FEE8AB6FE11F33E4E03.description: explain ways in which individuals' personal clothing decisions can be affected by change (e.g., fads and trends; changes in styles; development of new materials; changes in one's age, status, or social role)

CCDAF936C67F4E238CC8D7EBE8B5F89F.description: Wardrobe Planning and Clothing Selection: demonstrate an understanding of various factors affecting personal wardrobe planning and clothes selection.

9198BC428FE846B0A0360F5A0A158E0E.description: explain the impact that clothing can have on social interactions (e.g., how clothing's ability to contribute to unity or signal authority can affect interactions; what people's clothing can say about their values or personality, and how this might affect their interactions with others; how the ways we judge ourselves and others based on clothing can affect our interactions)

42AECC7836144C95887D2E8A995F72BC.description: describe the functions of clothing and accessories and the messages they convey (e.g., to protect against the weather; to convey status, power, or occupation; to adorn; to satisfy social conventions with respect to modesty or gender roles; to signal membership in a group)

20A536144F5640AA9778EF52952AA106.description: The Functions and Social Impact of Clothing: demonstrate an understanding of the functions clothing serves, the kinds of messages it conveys, and the impact it can have on social interactions;

6518B074B7CA40B79C77701AB5B4A381.description: demonstrate an understanding of the general research process by reflecting on and evaluating their own research, inquiry, and communication skills

D154A796BF4347B4A0064557D4A23886.description: clearly communicate the results of their inquiries (e.g., write clearly, organize ideas logically, use language conventions properly), and follow APA conventions for acknowledging sources (e.g., generate a reference list in APA style)

4545DC17652F4BAC9A0A465C24FBF883.description: use terms related to clothing correctly (e.g., fibres, fabrics, natural, synthetic, knit, crochet, weave, seam, hem, raw edge, wardrobe planning)

8A16BEBB3EA9461F845C7E935BE12147.description: use an appropriate format (e.g., oral presentation, brochure, poster, report, multimedia presentation, web page) to communicate the results of their research and inquiry effectively for a specific purpose and audience

605C73CFFD0148608735641EA49B247B.description: Communicating and Reflecting: communicate the results of their research and inquiry clearly and effectively, and reflect on and evaluate their research, inquiry, and communication skills.

85002FF9B2D94D3EA74768A8A1084BFD.description: synthesize findings and formulate conclusions (e.g., weigh and connect information to determine the answer to their research question)

0909DF712B8C4574AEC205FAE0E3DCD9.description: demonstrate academic honesty by documenting the sources of all information generated through research

D96E18251BB14C6E8660B43F1D24347A.description: analyse and interpret research information (e.g., compare observations with images obtained from magazines; determine whether common images arise in media products from different eras)

48B6ED1899C849E6B7C060968529D3A5.description: record and organize information and key ideas using a variety of formats (e.g., notes, graphic organizers, audio/digital records)

95086F46ECF841359038FE15ECBD1F88.description: assess various aspects of information gathered from primary and secondary sources (e.g., accuracy, relevance, reliability, inherent values and bias, voice)

F98DC5AFD6E54498B1EA5D9090A1CA8F.description: Processing Information: assess, record, analyse, and synthesize information gathered through research;

1CA03AE57CE24265A7D12AB3073975CF.description: based on preliminary research, for each investigation formulate a research question and use it to focus their research

856F1E2FCFE340709D0A77D498E98D45.description: locate and select information relevant to their investigations from a variety of primary sources (e.g., interviews, observations, surveys, HIF10/20 Clothing HNL2O questionnaires, fashion spreads in magazines) and/or secondary sources (e.g., textbooks, newspaper articles)

29BF1A3B603D4E268AE3D74071C77001.description: create appropriate research plans to investigate their chosen topic (e.g., outline purpose and method; identify sources of information), ensuring that their plans follow guidelines for ethical research

2D8B396FA3B3424984D31ED339689E57.description: Investigating: create research plans, and locate and select information relevant to their chosen topics, using appropriate social science research and inquiry methods;

56BE8AAAA2D241D99484B783AFEBAE5C.description: formulate effective questions to guide their research and inquiry

915758308B1B4921935DADA45B873036.description: identify key concepts (e.g., through discussion, brainstorming, use of visual organizers) related to their selected topics

6CA516572FBB4FA4AB5792468AD01C7A.description: explore a variety of topics related to clothing (e.g., fabrics, fibres, dress codes, wardrobe planning, evaluating clothing, consumer awareness) to identify topics for research and inquiry

AA03707ADCC74CDC864858DE7CEC9F1F.description: Exploring: explore topics related to clothing, and formulate questions to guide their research;
